name: summary_title
system_prompt:
You are an assistant tasked with comparing three lists of movies. For each movie, you are given its: title
Use your own judgment to determine what information is relevant when assessing the diversity of the lists. 
You should consider the given title for every movie, as well as an overall summary of the entire list.

The summary includes the following information:
    - Popularity Diversity: A score based on the mix of blockbuster movies and niche/independent films. The higher the score, the more balanced and more diverse is the list in this category.
    - Genre Diversity: A score based on the variety of genres represented in the list. The higher the score, the more diverse the genres.
    - Theme Diversity: A score based on the thematic range of the movies in the list. The higher the score, the more varied and expansive the themes across the movies in the list.
    - Time Span: Years of the earliest and latest movie releases in the list.
    - Franchise Inclusion: Whether the list includes at least two movies from the same franchise.

Deliver your descriptions of lists, comparison, and choice of the most diverse list in the following JSON format:

{
    "list_A_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list A
    "list_B_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list B
    "list_C_description": string,            # Describe the diversity of the movies in list C
    "comparison": string,                    # Compare the diversity of the lists.
    "most_diverse_list_reasoning": string,   # Explanation of which list you perceive to be the most diverse.
    "most_diverse_list": string              # The list you determine to be the most diverse, either 'A', 'B', or 'C'.
}

evaluations.prompt:
List A:
TITLE: Bourne Identity, The (2002)

TITLE: Snatch (2000)

TITLE: Bourne Supremacy, The (2004)

TITLE: Jurassic Park (1993)

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)

TITLE: Others, The (2001)

TITLE: Beautiful Mind, A (2001)

TITLE: The Hunger Games (2012)



Summary:
Popularity Diversity: The list contains a mix of blockbuster movies like Jurassic Park and The Hunger Games, and less popular films such as The Others and A Beautiful Mind.
Genre Diversity: The movie list covers a wide range of genres, including Action, Mystery, Thriller, Comedy, Crime, Sci-Fi, Adventure, Horror, Biography, and Drama.  Most movies have unique genres.
Theme Diversity: The movies in the list explore diverse themes such as amnesia, survival, family relationships, war, and mental illness, but there's some repetition, like the action-thriller theme appearing in multiple movies.
Time Span: The earliest movie is Jurassic Park (1993), and the latest is Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017).
Franchise Inclusion: Yes - The list includes at least two movies from the Bourne franchise: The Bourne Identity and The Bourne Supremacy.

List B:
TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)

TITLE: Catch Me If You Can (2002)

TITLE: Others, The (2001)

TITLE: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)

TITLE: Rain Man (1988)

TITLE: Avengers, The (2012)

TITLE: School of Rock (2003)

TITLE: Inglourious Basterds (2009)



Summary:
Popularity Diversity: The list includes both popular movies like Avengers and Guardians of the Galaxy, and less popular ones like Moonrise Kingdom and The Others. Therefore, it does not lean heavily on one side.
Genre Diversity: The movie list covers a wide range of genres, including Action, Adventure, Comedy, Sci-Fi, Biography, Crime, Drama, Horror, Mystery, Thriller, Family, Romance, Music, and War.  There is not a significant overlap or repetition of genres across multiple films.
Theme Diversity: The movies explore diverse themes such as family relationships (Guardians of the Galaxy, Rain Man), ambition and deception (Catch Me If You Can), the supernatural (The Others), love and coming-of-age (Moonrise Kingdom), heroism and sacrifice (Avengers), finding your passion (School of Rock), and war and revenge (Inglourious Basterds).  This demonstrates a broad thematic range.
Time Span: The earliest movie is Rain Man (1988), and the latest is Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017).
Franchise Inclusion: Yes - The list includes 'The Avengers' and 'Guardians of the Galaxy 2', both belonging to the Marvel Cinematic Universe franchise.

List C:
TITLE: Bourne Identity, The (2002)

TITLE: Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017)

TITLE: Others, The (2001)

TITLE: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)

TITLE: Edge of Tomorrow (2014)

TITLE: Bourne Supremacy, The (2004)

TITLE: War of the Worlds (2005)

TITLE: Rain Man (1988)



Summary:
Popularity Diversity: The list includes blockbuster movies like Guardians of the Galaxy and War of the Worlds, as well as less popular films such as The Others and Moonrise Kingdom.
Genre Diversity: The list covers genres such as Action, Adventure, Sci-Fi, Comedy, Drama, Family, Romance, Horror, and Mystery, but some genres such as Action and Thriller are repeated across multiple movies.
Theme Diversity: The movies in the list explore themes of amnesia, family relationships, war, love, survival, and autism. Some themes like survival and action are repeated across multiple movies.
Time Span: The earliest movie is Rain Man (1988) and the latest is Guardians of the Galaxy 2 (2017).
Franchise Inclusion: Yes - The list includes multiple movies from the Bourne series (The Bourne Identity and The Bourne Supremacy).

response.list_A_description: List A shows a good balance of popular and less popular movies.  Genre diversity is high, covering action, mystery, thriller, comedy, crime, sci-fi, adventure, horror, biography, and drama.  Theme diversity is moderate; while themes are varied, some repetition exists (e.g., action-thriller). The time span is from 1993 to 2017.  The list includes movies from the Bourne franchise.
response.list_B_description: List B demonstrates a strong balance between popular and niche films.  It boasts excellent genre diversity, encompassing action, adventure, comedy, sci-fi, biography, crime, drama, horror, mystery, thriller, family, romance, music, and war.  Thematic diversity is also high, with a wide range of themes explored, showing minimal repetition. The time span is from 1988 to 2017. The list includes movies from the Marvel Cinematic Universe.
response.list_C_description: List C offers a decent mix of popular and less popular movies. Genre diversity is good, but some genres like action and thriller are repeated. Theme diversity is moderate, with some thematic repetition (e.g., survival, action). The time span is from 1988 to 2017. The list includes movies from the Bourne franchise.
response.comparison: List B stands out due to its superior genre and theme diversity compared to Lists A and C. While all three lists contain a mix of popular and less popular films and include movies from the same franchise, List B's broader range of genres and themes, with minimal repetition, makes it the most diverse.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List B exhibits the highest level of diversity across all categories. Its genre and theme diversity surpasses Lists A and C, showcasing a wider range of cinematic experiences with less thematic overlap.  While Lists A and C have their strengths, List B's more comprehensive representation of genres and themes makes it the most diverse.

Genre Diversity: The movie list includes a variety of genres such as Action, Adventure, Drama, Fantasy, Mystery, Thriller, Comedy, Sci-Fi, Biography, Music, War, Animation, Family, and Crime. This wide range of genres indicates high genre diversity.
Theme Diversity: The movies cover diverse themes including war, survival, redemption, humor, prejudice, and personal relationships, indicating high theme diversity.
Time Span: The earliest movie is from 1994 (Shawshank Redemption), and the latest is from 2009 (District 9).
Franchise Inclusion: Yes - The list includes 'Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers', which is part of a larger franchise.

response.list_A_description: List A shows moderate popularity diversity with a mix of popular and less mainstream films.  It boasts high genre diversity, spanning action, comedy, drama, animation, and more. Theme diversity is moderate, with some thematic overlap. The time span is from 1994 to 2017.  No franchise inclusion is present.

response.list_C_description: List C exhibits moderate popularity diversity, including both blockbuster and niche films. It has high genre diversity, covering a wide range of genres. Theme diversity is high, with a varied range of themes. The time span is from 1994 to 2009.  Franchise inclusion is present with the Lord of the Rings movie.
response.comparison: All three lists show a decent variety in genres. List A and B have moderate theme diversity, while List C has high theme diversity. List C is the only one with franchise inclusion.  List A and C have higher genre diversity than List B. List B has the earliest time span.
response.most_diverse_list_reasoning: List C stands out due to its high genre and theme diversity, along with the inclusion of a movie franchise. While Lists A and B offer good genre variety, List C's thematic range and franchise inclusion give it an edge in terms of overall diversity.
